column1: quote
“And perhaps it is the greater grief, after all, to be left on earth when another is gone.” ― Madeline Miller, The Song of Achilles
“The meek may inherit the earth, but at the moment it belongs to the conceited. Like me.” ― Cassandra Clare, City of Bones
“Did you know that 'I told you so' has a brother,Jacob?" she asked cutting me off. "His name is 'Shut the hell up'.” ― Stephenie Meyer, Breaking Dawn

“All I'd ever wanted was to forget. but even when I thought I had, pieces had kept emerging, like bits of wood floating up to the surface that only hint at the shipwreck below.” ― Sarah Dessen, Just Listen
“Quotation, n: The act of repeating erroneously the words of another.” ― Ambrose Bierce, The Unabridged Devil's Dictionary
“I see all of you, Rhys. And there is not one part that I do not love with everything I am.” ― Sarah J. Maas, A Court of Wings and Ruin
“Your memory feels like home to me.So whenever my mind wanders, it always finds it’s way back to you.” ― Ranata Suzuki

“…the sad part is, that I will probably end up loving you without you for much longer than I loved you when I knew you.Some people might find that strange.But the truth of it is that the amount of love you feel for someone and the impact they have on you as a person, is in no way relative to the amount of time you have known them.” ― Ranata Suzuki
“[A] quotation is a handy thing to have about, saving one the trouble of thinking for oneself, always a laborious business."(The Record Lie)” ― A.A. Milne, If I May
“There is an ocean of silence between us… and I am drowning in it.” ― Ranata Suzuki
“What a curious power words have.” ― Tadeusz Borowski, This Way for the Gas, Ladies and Gentlemen
“She was a beautiful dreamer. The kind of girl, who kept her head in the clouds, loved above the stars and left regret beneath the earth she walked on.” ― robert m drake
“You don’t need scores of suitors. You need only one… if he’s the right one.” ― Louisa May Alcott, Little Women
“See the world as it is, not as you wish it would be” ― E. Lockhart, We Were Liars
“You can get a thousand no's from people, and only one "yes" from God.” ― Tyler Perry
“My feelings are too loud for words and too shy for the world.” ― Dejan Stojanovic
“We are made of all those who have built and broken us.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“I hate quotations. Tell me what you know.” ― Ralph Waldo Emerson, The Essays of Ralph Waldo Emerson
“She conquered her demons and wore her scars like wings. ” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“If you cannot hold me in your arms, then hold my memory in high regard.And if I cannot be in your life, then at least let me live in your heart.” ― Ranata Suzuki

“To conquer frustration, one must remain intensely focused on the outcome, not the obstacles.” ― T.F. Hodge, From Within I Rise: Spiritual Triumph over Death and Conscious Encounters With the Divine Presence

“If you’re searching for a quote that puts your feelings into words – you won’t find it.You can learn every language and read every word ever written – but you’ll never find what’s in your heart.How can you?He has it.” ― Ranata Suzuki
“In quoting others, we cite ourselves.” ― Julio Cortázar, Around the Day in Eighty Worlds

“When you experience loss, people say you’ll move through the 5 stages of grief….Denial, Anger, Bargaining, Depression, Acceptance….. What they don’t tell you is that you’ll cycle through them all every day.” ― Ranata Suzuki

“People who do a job that claims to be creative have to be alone to recharge their batteries. You can’t live 24 hours a day in the spotlight and remain creative. For people like me, solitude is a victory.” ― Karl Lagerfeld
“To hide feelings when you are near crying is the secret of dignity.” ― Dejan Stojanovic
“Death is the easy part, the hard part is living and knowing you could be so much more then you’re willing to be.” ― robert m drake

“A strong man cannot help a weaker unless the weaker is willing to be helped, and even then the weak man must become strong of himself; he must, by his own efforts, develop the strength which he admires in another. None but himself can alter his condition.” ― James Allen, As a Man Thinketh
“Love only grows by sharing. You can only have more for yourself by giving it away to others.” ― Brian Tracy

“It’s painful, loving someone from afar.Watching them – from the outside.The once familiar elements of their life reduced to nothing more than occasional mentions in conversations and faces changing in photographs…..They exist to you now as nothing more than living proof that something can still hurt you … with no contact at all.” ― Ranata Suzuki
“Quiet people have the loudest minds.” ― Stephen King

“I think perhaps I will always hold a candle for you – even until it burns my hand.And when the light has long since gone …. I will be there in the darkness holding what remains, quite simply because I cannot let go.” ― Ranata Suzuki
“It is a good thing for an uneducated man to read books of quotations.” ― Winston S. Churchill
“Watch carefully the magic that occurswhen you give a person enough comfort to just be themselves.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“I think it’s beautifulthe way you sparkle when you talk about the things you love.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“I had someone once who made every day mean something.And now…. I am lost….And nothing means anything anymore.” ― Ranata Suzuki
“She's an old soul with young eyes, a vintage heart, and a beautiful mind.” ― Nicole Lyons
“Mathematics expresses values that reflect the cosmos, including orderliness, balance, harmony, logic, and abstract beauty.” ― Deepak Chopra
“I love quotations because it is a joy to find thoughts one might have, beautifully expressed with much authority by someone recognized wiser than oneself.” ― Marlene Dietrich
“I am the shore and the ocean, awaiting myself on both sides.” ― Dejan Stojanovic, The Shape
“I miss that feeling of connection.Knowing he was out there somewhere thinking about me at the same time I was thinking about him.” ― Ranata Suzuki

“Plants are more courageous than almost all human beings: an orange tree would rather die than produce lemons, whereas instead of dying the average person would rather be someone they are not.” ― Mokokoma Mokhonoana
“He was both everything I could ever want…And nothing I could ever have…” ― Ranata Suzuki
“Create your own style… let it be unique for yourself and yet identifiable for others.” ― Anna Wintour
“It was her chaos that made her beautiful. ” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“Sometimes to self-discover you must self-destruct.” ― robert m drake
“It is beautiful to express love and even more beautiful to feel it.” ― Dejan Stojanovic
“There is nothing prettier in thewhole wide world than a girlin lovewith every breath she takes.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“Somewhere along the way we all go a bit mad. So burn, let go and dive into the horror, because maybe it’s the chaos which helps us find where we belong.” ― robert m drake
“She was afraid of heightsbut she was much more afraid of never flying.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“Your inner strength is your outer foundation” ― Allan Rufus
“I raised you so high that every other man on earth is now doomed to live in your shadow.” ― Ranata Suzuki
“Don’t spoil me with your lies, love me with your truth.” ― T.F. Hodge, From Within I Rise: Spiritual Triumph over Death and Conscious Encounters With the Divine Presence
“The last time I felt alive – I was looking into your eyes.Breathing your air…. touching your skin…… Saying goodbye….The last time I felt alive…. I was dying.” ― Ranata Suzuki
“It’s difficult for me to imagine the rest of my life without you. But I suppose I don’t have to imagine it... I just have to live it” ― Ranata Suzuki
“A tamed woman will never leave her mark in the world.” ― robert m drake
“Use the wings of the flying Universe, Dream with open eyes; See in darkness.” ― Dejan Stojanovic
“The most complicated skill is to be simple.” ― Dejan Stojanovic

“She turned to look at him, and he was already looking at her. “I’m going to miss you when I wake up,” she whispered, because she realized that she must have fallen asleep under the sun. Arin was too real for her imagination. He was a dream.“Don’t wake up,” he said.” ― Marie Rutkoski, The Winner's Crime
“I worry there is something broken in our generation,there are too many sad eyes on happy faces.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“Head up, heart open. To better days!” ― T.F. Hodge, From Within I Rise: Spiritual Triumph over Death and Conscious Encounters With the Divine Presence
“A sky full of starsand he was staring at her. —ATTICUS” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“It is beautiful, it is endless, it is full and yet seems empty. It hurts us.” ― Jackson Pearce, Fathomless
“The sky is not my limit...I am.” ― T.F. Hodge, From Within I Rise: Spiritual Triumph over Death and Conscious Encounters With the Divine Presence
“Though these words will never find you, I hope that you knew I was thinking of you today….. and that I was wishing you every happiness.Love Always,The girl you loved once.” ― Ranata Suzuki
“It’s always about timing. If it’s too soon, no one understands. If it’s too late, everyone’s forgotten.” ― Anna Wintour
“I'm restless. Things are calling me away. My hair is being pulled by the stars again.” ― Anaïs Nin
“Depression is being colorblind and constantly told how colorful the world is.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“She had just enough madness to make her interesting” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“I’m very much down to earth, just not this earth.” ― Karl Lagerfeld
“I WANT TO BE WITH SOMEONE WHO DREAMS OF DOING EVERYTHING IN LIFEAND NOTHING ON RAINY SUNDAY AFTERNOONS.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“The struggles we endure today will be the ‘good old days’ we laugh about tomorrow.” ― Aaron Lauritsen, 100 Days Drive: The Great North American Road Trip
“We swallowed the chaos because we knew we didn't want to be ordinary.” ― robert m drake
“The best kind of humans are the ones who stay.” ― robert m drake
“When God takes out the trash, don't go digging back through it. Trust Him.” ― Amaka Imani Nkosazana, Heart Crush
“To err is human, to purr is feline.” ― Robert Byrne, The 2,548 Best Things Anybody Ever Said
“No amount of me trying to explain myself was doing any good. I didn't even know what was going on inside of me, so how could I have explained it to them?” ― Sierra D. Waters, Debbie.

“Two seconds later, the sound of an alarm filled my ears. ''What did you do?'' I said over the noise as he backed up towards the bathroom door. ''The girl who gave you the note?''''Yes...''''I caught her staring at my lighter.''I blinked. ''You gave a child, in a psych ward , a lighter?''His eyes crinkled at the corners. ''She seemed trustworthy.''''You're sick,'' I said, but smiled.''Hey, nobody's perfect. '' Noah smiled back.” ― Michelle Hodkin, The Evolution of Mara Dyer
“From the moment I saw her I knew this onewas worththebroken heart.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“Fashion is a language that creates itself in clothes to interpret reality.” ― Karl Lagerfeld
“What good are wings without the courage to fly?” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“That was her magic— she could still see the sunseteven on those darkest days.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“Chase your stars fool, life is short. ” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“Madness and chaos are self-destructing but over thinking is the suicide.” ― robert m drake
“If I lived a million lives, I would've felt a million feelings and I still would've fallen a million times for you.” ― robert m drake
“I would have followed you to hell and back... if only you'd lead me back.” ― Ranata Suzuki
“The truth is I didn’t need therapy; I just needed to feel loved and know that someone out there craved my attention.” ― robert m drake
“I have poured my heart out ….And now I am empty.” ― Ranata Suzuki
“She wore the moonlight like lingerie. ” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“I let her gobecause I knew she could do betterand now she's goneI wonderif I should've just been better.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild

“I didn’t love you to seek revenge.I didn’t love you out of loneliness or unhappiness.I didn’t love you for any of the misguided reasons that time might convince you I did.I just loved you because you’re you.” ― Ranata Suzuki
“She was broken, I think it’s because she loved too much and she was always blind to the fact that love too is sometimes broken.” ― robert m drake
“Love me when I least deserve it, because that's when I really need it.” ― Swedish Proverb
“I visited many places, Some of them quite Exotic and far away, But I always returned to myself.” ― Dejan Stojanovic
“Your smile and your laughter lit my whole world.” ― Ranata Suzuki
“...we're dealing with two devils who both want to rule hell.” ― Ruta Sepetys, Between Shades of Gray
“Society will always be too fragile to accept us for all that makes us beautiful.” ― robert m drake
“Wherever I go, I meet myself.” ― Dejan Stojanovic, The Shape
“Appreciate the moment of a first kiss; it may be the last time you own your heart.” ― robert m drake
“Suddenly, everything was beautiful. The way she viewed the world was nothing more but a reflection of herself.” ― robert m drake
“It’s funny, for all it took was a broken heart and that alone was enough, enough for her to do everything she ever dreamed of.” ― robert m drake
“Brushing a girl’s hair behind her earonce a daywill solve more problemsthan all thosetherapists and drugs.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“We need houses as we need clothes, architecture stimulates fashion. It’s like hunger and thirst — you need them both.” ― Karl Lagerfeld

“An open Facebook page is simply a psychiatric dry erase board that screams, “Look at me. I am insecure. I need your reaction to what I am doing, but you’re not cool enough to be my friend. Therefore, I will just pray you see this because the approval of God is not all I need.” ― Shannon L. Alder
“Time is all we have and don’t. ” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“I had to learn to live without you and I couldn't make sense of it, because I left so much of me inside of you.” ― robert m drake
“To be human is to be broken and broken is its own kind of beautiful.” ― robert m drake

“An emotion clamped down on her heart. It squeezed her into a terrible silence. But he said nothing after that, only her name, as if her name were not a name but a question. Or perhaps that it wasn’t how he had said it, and she was wrong, and she’d heard a question simply because the sound of him speaking her name made her wish that she were his answer.” ― Marie Rutkoski, The Winner's Crime
“Sometimes I want a quiet lifeother timesI want to go a little bit fucking Gatsby.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“There is a point to everything or nothing at all, depending on your worldview.” ― Suzanne Collins, The Ballad of Songbirds and Snakes
“It was never the way she lookedalways the way she wasI would have fallen in love with her with my eyes closed.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“I will follow you, my love, to the edge of all our days,to our very last tomorrows.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild

“She was broken from moment to moment, watching her world collide she felt lost inside herself. She fell apart for a passion that flamed beneath her. She waited and died a hundred times, it dripped from her pores. The moment she let go, she soared over the stillness like the star she was born to be.” ― robert m drake
“Love knows no limit to its endurance, no end to its trust, no fading of its hope; it can outlast anything. Love still stands when all else has fallen.” ― Blaise Pascal
“It's inevitable. When you meet the one who makes you smile as you've never smiled before, cry as you've never cried before... there is nothing to do but fall.” ― Renee Ahdieh, The Wrath and the Dawn
“Thinking of you is a poison I drink often. ” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“You cannot be truly humble, unless you truly believe that life can and will go on without you.” ― Mokokoma Mokhonoana
“I'm your friend, and friends don't let friends die.” ― C.B. Cook, Twinepathy
“Some people talk about other people’s failures with so much pleasure that you would swear they are talking about their own successes.” ― Mokokoma Mokhonoana
“He looked at me like I was the stars when all I’d ever felt like was the dark nothingness between them.” ― Ranata Suzuki
“She was born to be free, let her run wild in her own way and you will never lose her.” ― Nikki Rowe
“My God,' he gasped, 'you're fun to kiss.” ― F. Scott Fitzgerald, Tender Is the Night
“There is another alphabet, whispering from every leaf, singing from every river, shimmering from every sky.” ― Dejan Stojanovic
“Non-judgment quiets the internal dialogue, and this opens once again the doorway to creativity.” ― Deepak Chopra
“Each of us is a unique strand in the intricate web of life and here to make a contribution.” ― Deepak Chopra
“The woman is the most perfect doll that i have dressed with delight and admiration.” ― Karl Lagerfeld
“I want everyone to wear what they want and mix it in their own way. That, to me, is what is modern.” ― Karl Lagerfeld
“It was never about the world being too big, it was more like she was too much for the world to handle.” ― robert m drake
“Maybe I hope too much. Maybe I dream too much or maybe I love too much to just give up on you.” ― robert m drake
“It’s times like this…. when it’s over a year later and I’m still crying over you that I want to turn to you and say: See…. This is why I asked you never to kiss me.” ― Ranata Suzuki

“He had not breathed a word of love, or dropped one hint of tenderness or affection, and yet I had been supremely happy. To be near him, to hear him talk as he did talk, and to feel that he thought me worthy to be so spoken to - capable of understanding and duly appreciating such discourse - was enough.” ― Anne Brontë, Agnes Grey
“Love, too, was just a question of time” ― Paulo Coelho, The Devil and Miss Prym
“Even if you are alone you wage war with yourself.” ― Dejan Stojanovic, The Sun Watches the Sun
“Words don’t have the power to hurt you, unless that person meant more to you than you are willing to confess.” ― Shannon L. Alder

“the best part waspulling down theshadesstuffing the doorbellwith ragsputting the phonein therefrigeratorand going to bedfor 3 or 4days. and the next bestpartwasnobody evermissedme.” ― Charles Bukowski, You Get So Alone at Times That it Just Makes Sense
“Don't worry— you see, to some you are magic.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild

“I was never really certain why he scared the bejesus out of me. Nothing scared me growing up. I’ve been playing with dead people since the day I was born, so it’s good thing, yet the Big Bad scared me. Which brings me to the reason I called.” “Which was to give me nightmares for the rest of my life?” “Oh, no, that’s just a plus. Why was I so scared of him?” “Hon, for one thing he was this powerful, massive, black smokelike being.”“So, you’re saying I’m a racist?” ― Darynda Jones, Third Grave Dead Ahead
“What young brains lack in experience they sometimes make up for in idealism. Nothing seems impossible to them.” ― Suzanne Collins, The Ballad of Songbirds and Snakes
“Our songslive longer thanour kingdoms.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“Love what is simple and beautiful. These are the essentials.” ― Ralph Waldo Emerson, The Tao of Emerson the Tao of Emerson
“She was not for everyone but she was for me. ” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“There will alwaysa glimmer in thosewho have been through the dark.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“I just need you and some sunsets. ” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“Art takes time—Monet grew his gardensbefore he painted them.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“She is of the strangest beauty and the darkest courage, and when she walks with intent the earth trembles beneath her feet.” ― Nicole Lyons, Hush
“Whatever others may say, they say it to deceive and comfort themselves, not help you.” ― Dejan Stojanovic, The Sun Watches the Sun
“She was another broken doll dreaming of a boy with glue. ” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild

“Vengeance ought to be spoken through gritted teeth, spittle flying, the cords of one's soul so entangled in it that you can't let it go, even if you try. If you feel it--if you really feel it--then you speak it like it's a still-beating heart clenched in your fist and there's blood running down your arm, dripping off your elbow, and you can't let go.” ― Laini Taylor, Strange the Dreamer
“Let there be room left in your heart for the unimaginable ~ serendipity has a way of showing itself just when you feel like giving up.” ― Nikki Rowe
“From this point forward, you don’t even know how to quit in life.”~ Aaron Lauritsen, ‘100 Days Drive” ― Aaron Lauritsen
“Luxury is the ease of a t-shirt in a very expensive dress.” ― Karl Lagerfeld

“It's in those quiet little towns, at the edge of the world, that you will find the salt of the earth people who make you feel right at home.” ― Aaron Lauritsen, 100 Days Drive: The Great North American Road Trip
“Reinvent new combinations of what you already own. Improvise. Become more creative. Not because you have to, but because you want to. Evolution is the secret for the next step.” ― Karl Lagerfeld
“A breeze, a forgotten summer, a smile, all can fit into a storefront window.” ― Dejan Stojanovic, The Sun Watches the Sun
“You are not what you are; You are darkness Looking for light within.” ― Dejan Stojanovic, Circling: 1978-1987
“I think we owe it to ourselves to unapologetically love who we are no matter what. Because if you don’t love yourself, then why do you expect anyone else to?” ― Lauren Asher, Redeemed
“Maybe love was meant to save us from ourselves.” ― robert m drake
“She wildly burned for the one she loved and he stood there watching, hoping he too would catch a blaze from the violence stirring in her heart.” ― robert m drake

“It hurts to let go, to say goodbye for the final time and remain distant in your closure, it may even tear your heart out to the point of insanity; but somehow in it all you find the pieces of your worth and you start creating yourself again, and in that journey of transformation you find the essence of what truly matters, inner happiness. It's life, we all fall at some stage but it's up to you, to decide how long you want to stay there.” ― Nikki Rowe
“You’re not a bad person, you’re just a little bit different and I’m a sucker for that.” ― robert m drake
“A relationship is likely to last way longer, if each partner convinces or has convinced themselves that they do not deserve their partner, even if that is not true.” ― Mokokoma Mokhonoana
“Deep at the center of my being there is an infinite well of love.” ― Louise L. Hay, You Can Heal Your Life
“I need you because I know I deserve you but let me fall in love with you one last time before I let go. So I can remember the beautiful imperfection that rattled my bones.” ― robert m drake
“One hand I extend into myself, the other toward others.” ― Dejan Stojanovic, The Shape
“As he took her handhe gave herall she had beenwaiting for--a shiverdown her spine.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“THE HARDESTSTEPWE ALL MUST TAKEIS TO BLINDLY TRUST IN WHO WE ARE. - ATTICUS” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild

“The ego lusts for satisfaction. It has a prideful ferocious appetite for its version of "truth". It is the most challenging aspect to conquer; the cause for most spiritual turmoil.” ― T.F. Hodge, From Within I Rise: Spiritual Triumph over Death and Conscious Encounters With the Divine Presence
“Love spiritually, not strategically.” ― T.F. Hodge, From Within I Rise: Spiritual Triumph over Death and Conscious Encounters With the Divine Presence
“She found herselfover a long and treacherous roadand the more treacherous the road became,the more of herselfshe found.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild

“She had more of me then I had of myself. We were both wild birds chasing the stars. We’d lose our way and find new places, close our eyes and fall back towards a constellation of dreams. We wrapped ourselves in a blanket of passion and each night we fell deeper without control, into this strange space called love.” ― robert m drake
“We are sometimes dragged into a pit of unhappiness by someone else’s opinion that we do not look happy.” ― Mokokoma Mokhonoana
“A few drinks and the world was hers— she wore her whiskey like a loaded gun.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“Don't ask her to be a rock for you to lean uponinstead, build her wingsand point her to the skyand she will teach you both to fly.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“She walkedthrough her lifeheavyfrom themighty wingsupon her back.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“We must all be allowed our moments of insanity and senselessness. Without them, what sort of dull, lifeless creatures would we be?” ― Hannah Linder

“I could have loved him with everything I had but he wasn't prepared for the depth i provided ~ had I been a woman of weakness I would have stayed, but he lost the chance when he said I wasn't enough that day.” ― Nikki Rowe

“Some of us were brought into this troubled world primarily or only to increase our fathers’ chances of not being left by our mothers, or vice versa.” ― Mokokoma Mokhonoana, The Use and Misuse of Children
“The deeper thought is, the taller it becomes.” ― Dejan Stojanovic, The Sun Watches the Sun
“Some of the best things that have ever happened to us wouldn’t have happened to us, if it weren’t for some of the worst things that have ever happened to us.” ― Mokokoma Mokhonoana
“Words will scratch more hearts than swords.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“But dear, don’t be afraid of love it’s only magic.” ― robert m drake
“She will blaze through you like a gypsy wildfire. Igniting you soul and dancing in its flames. And when she is gone, the smell of her smoke will be the only thing left to soothe you.” ― Nicole Lyons
“I have seen your darkest nights and brightest days and I want you to knowthat I will be here forever loving you in dusk.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“Life's trials will test you, and shape you, but don’t let them change who you are.”~ Aaron Lauritsen, ‘100 Days Drive” ― Aaron Lauritsen, 100 Days Drive: The Great North American Road Trip
“I try to do something positive – I socialise more…But deep down I know the truth.An entire world of people can never replace the one that I’ve lost.” ― Ranata Suzuki
“It's such a silly little thing, the heart.” ― Ned Vizzini, It's Kind of a Funny Story
“What a strange world. We trade our days for things.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild

“Life is too complicated and expansive to be judged solely by the career you have. You could be unhappy doing something you liked, just as it was possible to do what you didn't like but derive happiness from something entirely different. Life is mysterious and complex. Work plays an important role in life, but it isn't solely responsible for our happiness or misery” ― Hwang Bo-reum, Welcome to the Hyunam-Dong Bookshop
“Politeness is the first thing people lose once they get the power.” ― Amit Kalantri, Wealth of Words
“Since there is no real silence, Silence will contain all the sounds, All the words, all the languages, All knowledge, all memory.” ― Dejan Stojanovic
“We love being mentally strong, but we hate situations that allow us to put our mental strength to good use.” ― Mokokoma Mokhonoana
“The moment you start arguing with an ignorant fool, you have already lost.” ― Imam Ali AS
“We are never alone We are all wolves Howling to the same moon.” ― Atticus Poetry, Atticus
“Fashion and music are the same, because music express its period too.” ― Karl Lagerfeld
“Old words are reborn with new faces.” ― Criss Jami, Killosophy
“They say “Follow your heart”….…. But I can’t follow you where you’re going…” ― Ranata Suzuki

“A physical attraction is often desired above many things but you'll discover it to be short lived. Find yourself someone that gets under your skin, seduces the dusty corners of your heart, and provides you with a mental connection. That is when you'll know true intimacy.” ― M.J. Abraham

“Tough love may be tough to give, but it is a necessity of life and assurance of positive growth.” ― T.F. Hodge, From Within I Rise: Spiritual Triumph over Death and Conscious Encounters With the Divine Presence
“All worries are less with wine.” ― Amit Kalantri, Wealth of Words

“Look at the evils of the world around you and protect yourself from them. Our teachers give all the wrong messages to our youth, since they take away the natural flare from the soul. Take it from me that all knowledge is useless until it is connected with your life, because the purpose of knowledge is nothing but to show you the splendors of yourself!” ― Sir Muhammad Iqbal Allama Iqbal
“That's the problem with best friends. Sometimes they know you better than you know yourself.” ― Cecily von Ziegesar, Nobody Does It Better
“LOVE COULD BE LABLEDPOISON AND WE’D DRINK IT ANYWAYS.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“Come, my darling,it is never too late to begin our love again.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“Life sometimes reminds us that it is sometimes heartless by giving something or someone we really need to someone who does not need or even want them or it.” ― Mokokoma Mokhonoana
“He can’t take his eyes off the stars, but I can’t take mine off his face.” ― Amie Kaufman, This Shattered World
“THE RIGHTPOEM FINDS US EXACTLY WHEN IT NEEDS TO.—ATTICUS” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild

“The most upsetting thing about Society’s attitude towards disabled people is that many millions of disabled people became disabled while trying to please Society, the very same bitch that secretly regards them as subhuman.” ― Mokokoma Mokhonoana, The Use and Misuse of Children
“And the stars blinked as they watched her carefully jealous of the way she shone.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“She sat in her perfect house, with her perfect husband, wishing that her perfect life would end.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild
“True artcomes from flying with the madnessso close you burn your eyelashes.” ― Atticus Poetry, Love Her Wild

“Wild woman are an unexplainable spark of life. They ooze freedom and seek awareness, they belong to nobody but themselves yet give a piece of who they are to everyone they meet. If you have met one, hold on to her, she'll allow you into her chaos but she'll also show you her magic.” ― Nikki Rowe
“She’d felt it before, she felt it now: the pull to fall in with him, to fall into him, to lose her sense of self.” ― Marie Rutkoski, The Winner's Crime
“I am looking for the one I can’t fool.” ― Kamand Kojouri
“To risk life to save a smile on a face of a woman or a child is the secret of chivalry.” ― Dejan Stojanovic
“Life felt like hell, because we expected it to feel like heaven.” ― Penelope Douglas, Kill Switch

“One often hears of writers that rise and swell with their subject, though it may seem but an ordinary one. How, then, with me, writing of this Leviathan? Unconsciously my chirography expands into placard capitals. Give me a condor's quill! Give me Vesuvius' crater for an inkstand! Friends, hold my arms! For in the mere act of penning my thoughts of this Leviathan, they weary me, and make me faint with their out-reaching comprehensiveness of sweep, as if to include the whole circle of the sciences, and all the generations of whales, and men, and mastodons, past, present, and to come, with all the revolving panoramas of empire on earth, and throughout the whole universe, not excluding its suburbs. Such, and so magnifying, is the virtue of a large and liberal theme! We expand to its bulk. To produce a mighty book, you must choose a mighty theme. No great and enduring volume can ever be written on the flea, though many there be who have tried it.” ― Herman Melville, Moby-Dick or, The Whale

“Mindfulness (A poem)***MINDFULNESS ******We're sitting on a hill, reminiscing about our deeds.These are mesmerising moments of ease; scenes are harmonising in keys.But we're in a state of oblivion, shunned from the view of fate in this period.We think about the nice days from our teens; the things that we did at our free will.We're in sync with the future and past tensions. Indeed, we could enjoy the present intentions. But we're in a state of oblivion, shunned from the view of fate in this period.We envision our problems gone; with collisions exposed and pawned.Oh! We could enjoy this peaceful time, on this hill, watching the sunrise.But we're in a state of oblivion, shunned from the view of fate in this period.The beautiful birds stride pass our face.Thick cuticles blurred, striped by hours of grace.They flap their wings, forming art; tail lamps for us, bleeding hearts.But we're in a state of oblivion, shunned from the view of fate in this period.People of different cultures come to us.Simple, they offer their services; no Judas.Wave their hands with care; give their food to share.But we're in a state of oblivion, shunned from the view of fate in this period.What a sad case this is; our mindfulness is butchered.Heads are swimming inbetween the past and the future.Opportunities to love others in truth are being missed.Communities could share love so true; limiting the rifts.But we're in a state of oblivion, shunned from the view of fate in this period.” ― Mitta Xinindlu

“A Hymn I sang When I Found You (Poem)******You opened your arms to meand my eyes to see.You embraced me like your own.In your soul, You covered me with strength.You opened my life with your breath.Your comfort embraces my heartlike what paint is to art, and jokes are to comedy, and religion is to a prophecy, and guitars are to music.Importantly, you adorn me as artists do to the muse.You swallowed me with your mind.Sewn my broken pieces back into one, and loved me throughout your research.Like what members are to the church, and grapes are to wine, and mud is to a swine.I was lost, Now, I'm perfectly found at most.In your love, I'm pulled.Complete and fullwithout a piece amiss.I'm washed with plenty a kiss.A perfect melody! Long gone are the days of melancholy.Because no strange songs are sung.You pierce into me like the sunand comfort me like charms.Mostly, you sing me a lullaby in your arms.” ― Mitta Xinindlu

“Te sientes sola cuando sales con un chico, y haces el amor en su piso, y él se esfuerza por ser simpático y hacerte sentir bien, pero es como si todas sus atenciones se dirigiesen a tu cuerpo y no a tu mente (te hace el amor, te hace la cena) y sientes que cada minuto que pasas con él solo contribuye a que os canséis un poco más el uno del otro, y cuando os separáis finges que es doloroso, pero en realidad lo estás deseando porque supone un alivio dejar de esforzarte por complacer al otro, y cuando llegas a casa tientes la impresión de que él ya no ha vuelto a pensar en ti desde que saliste de la suya, tienes la sensación de que has salido de su vida para siempre, aunque sepas que al día siguiente te volverá a llamar y volverás a tener sexo con él, pero esa noche, mientras te desnudas en silencio y te metes en la cama, estás segura de que él no está pensando en ti, que nadie piensa en ti, en realidad, y también estás segura de que si descuelgas el teléfono y llamas a tu madre, a tus hermanas o a alguna de tus pocas amigas, o lo llamas a él, cualquiera de ellos se sorprenderá de ver tu número y de oír tu voz, y les llevará unos segundos hacer un hueco para acomodar tu presencia en su mundo, porque solo eres algo ajeno que entra y sale a la escena de sus vidas, algo que no deja más huella que un tenue rastro de incomodidad. “Yes, I fail at missing you… but don’t mistake that for love, because that’s just out of habit. The truth is, I don’t even want to remember you anymore. Not your face, not your voice, not the version of me that tolerated you. You were a chapter that felt right, but it was a disaster. But now that I’ve grown, I’ve changed, I know the reality… I see you for who you are. So if forgetting you is slow, that’s fine. One day, even your memory will realise it is no longer welcome here.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“Forgiving someone who fooled you is one of the hardest things. Especially when it’s someone you truly respected. You keep fighting between anger and empathy between hurting them back and understanding that we all make mistakes. But forgiveness isn’t about them. It’s about freeing yourself. It’s a long, emotional loop where some days you will hate them and some days you will understand them.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“Some truths hit slow. Some goodbyes hurt longer. Some wounds never fully heal. Some conversations stay unfinished. Some thoughts stay thoughts. Some relationships hurt more than they heal… and we wait for closure that never comes. But this is life in its purest form, messy, unpredictable, and brutally honest. And this is how life teaches us that we don’t get to control how people love us, how they leave, or how they change. All we can control is how we heal after the hurt and how we rise after the fall.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote
“This is my life homie you decide yours” ― Kanye West
“Between Empathy and Compassion lies the toughest and the longest road you will ever take. Patience and calmness are two key resources which make the journey possible.” ― Ramesh Sood

“You know, I used to feel proud after every argument. I used to think winning a fight meant I was strong. I used to think being right all the time would make me happy. But now I understand… every time you try to prove someone close to you wrong, you don’t win respect, you lose it. You don’t become stronger, you just become someone others want to avoid. Because sometimes it's about losing the argument, but winning the relationship.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“Be a go-getter. Be a game-changer. Ascend the towering mountains in prayer, and watch the Lord change your life for the better.” ― Gift Gugu Mona, Coming to Grips with the Mountains and Valleys of This World
“Before you climb those mountains, do not forget to pray, for His light will guide you along the way.” ― Gift Gugu Mona, Coming to Grips with the Mountains and Valleys of This World

“Do not go to bed without taking time to pray. Thank God for helping you climb the mountains of the day and giving you the wisdom to tackle the valleys of tomorrow.” ― Gift Gugu Mona, Coming to Grips with the Mountains and Valleys of This World
“It is important to pray as you face difficult mountains. By God’s grace, you will reach new fountains.” ― Gift Gugu Mona, Coming to Grips with the Mountains and Valleys of This World
“Locate the mountains meant for you to climb. Climb them one at a time, and do so with the Lord by your side.” ― Gift Gugu Mona, Coming to Grips with the Mountains and Valleys of This World

“Pray and invite God to help you deal with the unmoveable mountains. He may not take them away completely, but He can prepare you to climb them as if it were easy.” ― Gift Gugu Mona, Coming to Grips with the Mountains and Valleys of This World
“Pray as you scale the mountains ahead of you. Ask God to help you recognize the ones you should subdue.” ― Gift Gugu Mona, Coming to Grips with the Mountains and Valleys of This World
“Pray for strength and be well-prepared to face the mountains that hinder you in this world.” ― Gift Gugu Mona, Coming to Grips with the Mountains and Valleys of This World
“The Lord will empower you to climb various mountains. When you pray, He will see you through your days of triumph.” ― Gift Gugu Mona, Coming to Grips with the Mountains and Valleys of This World
“There shall be many mountains along the way, but if you pray, you will find the way to a brighter day.” ― Gift Gugu Mona, Coming to Grips with the Mountains and Valleys of This World
“When perilous mountains show up unexpectedly, pray. Find strength from above for you to overcome challenges.” ― Gift Gugu Mona, Coming to Grips with the Mountains and Valleys of This World

“When you face mountains with rough terrains, pray; because prayer will let you experience God’s power in such an amazing way.” ― Gift Gugu Mona, Coming to Grips with the Mountains and Valleys of This World

“Whether in the stormy seas or on the highest mountains, do not forget to pray. When you pray, God’s grace will keep fear at bay.” ― Gift Gugu Mona, Coming to Grips with the Mountains and Valleys of This World

“Life becomes peaceful when you understand that your feelings belong to you, not to anyone else. People may hurt you, disappoint you, or leave you, but how long you stay affected is your choice. The moment you stop expecting others to handle your emotions, you start gaining control over your peace. In relationships, this truth saves you from a lot of pain. Because when your happiness depends only on others, you lose yourself. But when it comes from within, no one can take it away.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“Trust people until they show you why you shouldn’t trust them. Don’t assume everyone will hurt you, but don’t ignore the signs when they do. Watch how they treat you when you have nothing to offer, that’s where truth hides. Protect your heart from pain, but don’t let fear stop you from feeling. A closed heart keeps you safe, but it also keeps you lonely. So trust but not blindly. Be cautious, but not closed.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“I will smile again, that’s for sure. But I will never forget the nights I cried because of you, the nights I waited for a message that never came, the nights I questioned my worth for someone who didn’t care. Those nights broke me in ways no one saw, but they also made me stronger in ways you will never understand. I will smile again, and when I do, it will hurt you because you will realize the person you once took for granted learned to live better without you.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“There is something between us that is still there and I know it will always be there.. You know the worst thing is, we both feel it even today but we behave like nothing ever happened. We talk like strangers, we have moved on like adults, but somewhere inside, we still carry pieces of each other... with unsaid love.. And it hurts to know that our connection survived… but we didn’t.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“I feel what I feel… and I refuse to apologize for it. My heart has its reasons, my soul has its battles, and my truth is mine alone. If that makes you uncomfortable, I can’t help it. If you can’t handle it, stay out of my life.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote
“It's not like any of you could best me. I mean, it's three on one and you're still losing.” ― Matthew D. Devitt, The Quest for Freedom
“For there to be a winner, there must also be a loser. For one to prosper, one must sacrifice.” ― Matthew D. Devitt
“A man without God is like a jellyfish... It's alive, but empty inside.” ― Matthew D. Devitt
“He who talks with his actions will achieve much more than he who talks with his mouth.” ― Matthew D. Devitt
“What's the point if you're going to fail? But that's the same as saying "what's the point of living, if we're all going to die.” ― Matthew D. Devitt
“Life is only a fragment of our existence.” ― Matthew D. Devitt
“Remember every moment, even the bad ones... especially the bad ones, because it makes you even more grateful for the good ones.” ― Matthew D. Devitt
“Our minds are there to make our dreams a reality. Our imagination is there to make our dreams.” ― Matthew D. Devitt

“I agree with you because I don’t want to argue or fight, not because you are right. Sometimes peace feels more important than proving a point. I have learned that not every truth needs to be spoken, not every misunderstanding needs to be cleared. Some people only listen to reply, not to understand. So I stay quiet, not out of weakness, but out of wisdom. Because I have realized that keeping my peace is worth more than winning any argument.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“Silence may avoid fights, but it builds walls. At first, it feels like peace, no arguments, no tension. But slowly, that silence turns into distance. You stop explaining, they stop asking, and one day, there’s nothing left to say at all. The connection fades, not because of anger, but because both hearts stopped trying. Sometimes, silence doesn’t protect a relationship; it ends it quietly. So talk, even when it’s hard. Because honest words heal more than unspoken ones ever will.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote
“It’s been a while since me and you have fought each other, Ji. What’s say we spar, and then I can show you why I’m talking trash.” ― Matthew D. Devitt, The Quest for Freedom
“I don’t take orders from people who are weaker than me.” ― Matthew D. Devitt, The Quest for Freedom
“I’LL SHOW YOU WHY I WAS FEARED!” ― Matthew D. Devitt, The Quest for Freedom
“You praising someone is something I’ve only ever heard a few times, but for you to call someone terrifying… They must be a real monster.” ― Matthew D. Devitt, The Quest for Freedom

“Thank you for breaking my heart. Thank you for breaking my trust. Thank you for making me feel unworthy of you. Yes, it hurts… but at least I don’t have to waste my time on someone so selfish anymore. At least now I know I’m not with someone who doesn’t treat me right.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“The real heartbreak isn’t loud, it’s quiet. It’s when silence takes over everything. When two people who once talked for hours now don’t even know what to say. No anger, no closure, no fights, just a strange distance that can’t be seen but is deeply felt. You still care, but the words don’t come anymore. You still think of them, but the bond feels lost. That’s the kind of heartbreak that hurts the most when love doesn’t end with a goodbye, it just fades into silence.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“Love doesn’t really end with fights, it ends with silence. Fights still mean there’s care, there’s effort, there’s something to save. But silence means giving up. When two people stop talking, everything slowly fades, the connection, the warmth, the understanding. Not communicating with someone you love leaves a wound that never fully heals. You move on, but a part of you always remembers how silence replaced words, and how love turned into distance without saying a thing.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“You move on, you smile, you start living again… people think you are over it, and maybe you are. But somewhere inside, in those quiet moments, you still wish they feel the same pain one day, the kind of pain they gave you, the one that didn’t even let you breathe properly.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote
“Tu agar laut nhi aaya toh kya haasilAgar tu mera hota,toh kabhi jaata hi nahi” ― Wajid Shaikh , Sukoon

“Sometimes it’s not about revenge, not even about seeing them hurt. It’s just that deep inside, you wish they feel it once, the same pain, the same emptiness, the same sleepless nights they left you with.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote
“Every drowning man is selfish!” ― Md. Ziaul Haque
“প্রত্যেক ডুবন্ত মানুষই স্বার্থপর!” ― Md. Ziaul Haque
“Ultimately, the person you become is the result of your own choices—no one else can shape that destiny but you.” ― Chris Mentillo,
“Our most profound breakthroughs often arrive when we’re not actively seeking them.” ― Chris Mentillo

“Communication is not just about talking, it’s about understanding, listening, and making the other person feel heard. It’s the lifeline of every relationship, the bridge that keeps two hearts connected. Without it, small misunderstandings turn into distance, and silence starts to replace love. People don’t stop loving each other overnight; they just stop feeling understood. That’s how even the strongest bonds slowly fade, not because love ended, but because communication did. So, talk before it’s too late. Listen before they stop trying. Because once silence takes over, words can’t fix what’s already broken.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote
“Jump”. I do, and he catches me. Like he always does.” ― Vanessa Linhares, Peyton

“Relationships don’t fall apart in a day, they fade slowly, almost quietly. It starts when effort turns into assumption, when conversations become shorter, and care feels routine. Love alone is never enough, it needs patience, communication, and small acts of effort every single day. The truth is, distance doesn’t always begin with fights, it begins with silence, with “maybe tomorrow.” And before we even notice, the bond that once felt unbreakable starts to feel distant. Because every relationship survives on effort, not emotion.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“I will move on someday, but I will never forget how much you made me cry, not because I am still stuck on you, but because those tears taught me who you truly were. You showed me how love can feel worse than hatred, how silence can hurt more than words, and how care can turn into control. One day, my heart will stop aching, but the memory of how you treated me will always stay. And that’s not bitterness, that’s awareness because you were a lesson, not a loss.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“You think your silence means peace, but to me, it feels like a distance I never chose. You call it space, I call it disappearing. You call it calm, I call it coldness. Silence doesn’t always heal, it sometimes kills what words could have saved. And maybe one day, you will realize that ignoring someone who cared was never peace, it was a slow destruction of a beautiful relationship.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote
“I know you said it in anger, but deep down, I know it was the truth.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“True wisdom starts with recognizing God and being humble, but our culture prioritizes practical and technological knowledge, which can overlook spiritual and moral wisdom. Balancing our knowledge with a sense of right and wrong is key to being truly wise.” ― Olivia Rose. T

“Life's purpose is to praise and honor God, and making praise a top priority shifts focus to things that bring us closer to God, like prayer and serving others and this brings purpose and meaning, and helps stay focused on what's important.” ― Olivia Rose. T

“Holiness means living differently from the world, focusing on what's right and pleasing to God, and prioritizing relationships and actions that reflect God's love and character. It requires being intentional about avoiding worldly pressures and staying focused on God's standards.” ― Olivia Rose. T
“I would rather be hated by the world and loved by myself than loved by the world and hated by myself.” ― Matthew D. Devitt

“Your problem is that you've gotten lazy and complacent! You put your life on the line, training every day to reach the top, and when you got there, you forgot how to climb, you forgot the struggle, the burn, the grind. If you kept pushing yourself and kept striving for greatness, you would have been the greatest fighter the elves have ever seen.” ― Matthew D Devitt
“No one normal is going to change the world.” ― Matthew D Devitt
“Just because you aren't a slave doesn't mean you're necessarily free.” ― Matthew D Devitt, The Quest for Freedom

“This just gives us more motivation to keep going. To clean out the trash of society and not only free our people, but do our part to help rectify the wrongdoings that happen on this planet.” ― Matthew D Devitt, The Quest for Freedom
“I'd rather be hated for who I am, than loved for who I am not.” ― Matthew D Devitt
“There is no perfect time to start something.” ― Matthew D Devitt

“You know, insecure people often put the burden of fixing their pain on others, especially the ones they love. I will be honest, I did this too. I thought someone’s presence could heal what was broken inside me. But I eventually realized that no one can fix what’s broken within you. And depending on others only makes you weaker, emptier, and lost. You slowly forget yourself while trying to hold on to them. So don’t do that. Your insecurities are your responsibility. Learn from them, grow through them, don’t pass them on. Because the moment you depend on someone for your peace, you lose yourself.” ― Garima Soni

“I don’t talk much anymore, not because I have nothing to say, but because I know you will blame me. Every word turns into an argument, every feeling becomes my fault. So I stay quiet not out of peace, but out of exhaustion. It’s easier to stay silent than to be misunderstood again and again. Silence becomes a shield when words no longer feel safe. And that’s when you realize sometimes it’s not that people stop talking, they just stop feeling heard.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“I will remember how you ignored me when I needed you the most. How you avoided my calls, my messages, my silence as if my pain was too heavy for you to notice. I won’t hold a grudge, but I will remember the emptiness your absence created because that’s when I learned who truly cares and who only stays when it’s easy. Some lessons don’t come with anger, they come with distance. And this one taught me never to expect presence from those who disappear when it matters most.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“But what about rule number one," I can't help but breathe, and all he does is smile. "Fuck the rules, Tink." Then his mouth is on mine, robbing me of any response, and I am both his wife, and a slut for the boy who is my crush, so who am I to not kiss him back?” ― G.N. Wright, The Puck Decoy
“There is an ache in my chest so painful that it feels as though someone has taken an ax to it, and I'm not entirely convinced they haven't.” ― G.N. Wright, The Puck Decoy
“I think I need a bigger mouth. More alcohol would fit in it.” ― Penelope Douglas, Nightfall

“Love isn’t everything, it’s just one part of everything you deserve. You deserve respect, peace, honesty, support, and understanding, too. Love without these things feels heavy and incomplete. Real happiness comes when love adds to your life, not when it becomes the only reason you live.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“Yes, I felt like telling you the truth, but I couldn’t gather the courage. Not because I wanted to hide, but because I was scared, scared of losing you, scared of being misunderstood. I know it was my fault, and I will take that. But my intentions were never wrong. Everything I did came from a place of care, not selfishness. Sometimes we make mistakes not out of a bad heart, but out of fear. And that fear costs us the people we never wanted to lose.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“Boredom may look harmless, but it quietly pulls you into things you don’t even need. It makes you scroll endlessly, text people you have moved on from, or chase excitement in places that drain your peace. When the mind has nothing meaningful to hold on to, it starts searching for chaos, just to feel something. That’s why boredom is dangerous, it doesn’t come alone. It brings temptation, confusion, and regret with it.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“Yes, I know I am not perfect. I make mistakes, I overthink, and I overreact, too, but at least I am not like you. At least I don’t use people and then throw them out of my life when I am done. I don’t pretend to care just to fill my empty moments. When I give my time, I mean it. When I care, I genuinely do. I don’t treat people like options or memories that can be erased when they no longer serve me. Maybe I would have hurt you, but who doesn't hurt? Have you not hurt me ever?” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“The day I start revealing your truth, you will have nowhere to go. Because deep down, you know what you have done, how you twisted things, how you made me look wrong just to save your image. And I still kept trying to convince you that we should clear the misunderstanding, not because I was weak, but because I thought you had some grace and some respect for what we had. But now I am not going to consider anything, now if I decide to speak, the truth will be louder than all the lies ever told. And that day, your mask will fall, and your ugly reality will be known to everyone.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“Some relationships don’t break you all at once they slowly take away your peace and energy. You start feeling tired, even when nothing big has happened. That’s how you know something is wrong. Love should make you feel calm and safe, not confused and restless. If you always have to explain yourself or fight to be understood, that’s not love, that’s pain. It’s hard to accept, but some people love in ways that hurt. Walking away from that doesn’t make you selfish, it makes you wise because peace is the kind of love you truly deserve.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“The pain of silence is heavier than the pain of truth. Truth may hurt for a while, but silence hurts every day. It leaves you guessing, overthinking, and carrying questions that never find answers. When someone chooses silence, it creates distance, confusion, and doubt. You start wondering what went wrong, and that ache slowly grows inside you. Honesty may be hard, but it brings clarity. Silence only leaves emptiness. So choose truth, even if it shakes you for a moment, because silence breaks you slowly, without saying a word.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“I don’t even care about your existence anymore, forget about what you think about me...That’s how far things have gone. It’s not hate, it’s just peace after too much pain. It's relief after too much restlessness.... and that's because you stop caring how much you love someone if they make you feel like they don't even care about it...” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote
“CHARGE FORTH, STRIKE DOWN OUR FOES AND BRING WASTE TO THE CITY STREETS! LET OUR VICTORY BE SO MONUMENTAL THAT IT IS FELT THROUGHOUT ALL OF AFFER!” ― Matthew D. Devitt, The Quest for Freedom
“I wouldn't expect a naysayer to understand. But trust me, everything falls into place exactly as it should.” ― Matthew D. Devitt, The Quest for Freedom
“Patience, Ji. Don't try to climb steps you haven't reached yet; you'll end up falling.” ― Matthew D. Devitt, The Quest for Freedom
“I'd rather die a free man, or at least perish while trying to become one, than live as a slave.” ― Matthew D. Devitt, The Quest for Freedom
“I would rather die trying to become who I want to be, than live as someone I was not.” ― Matthew D. Devitt

“Death is a part of freedom. Blood will be spilled whether we fight this war or stand down and stay as slaves. I'm trying to put humans back at the top where we belong. It's all I've ever thought about…freedom and victory. My only purpose in life is to rectify the disposition of this damn world, and I'll do whatever it takes to do that.” ― Matthew D Devitt, The Quest for Freedom
“A wise man doesn't seek war, but he's always prepared for it.” ― Matthew D Devitt
“Something’s only impossible because it hasn’t been done yet.” ― Matthew D Devitt, The Quest for Freedom

“My broken heart taught me that self-love is not just the best love — it is the only love that truly stays. People leave, promises fade, and feelings change, but the way we treat ourselves decides how we survive it all. When everything falls apart, the only love that can heal us, hold us, and help us rise again is our own.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“I don’t get it. Why am I not important to you now? How do people just stop caring like that? One day I was someone you couldn’t stop talking to, and now, it feels like I never even mattered. It’s strange I still think about you, still miss you, but you don’t. You just moved on, quietly, like I was never a part of your story. And I keep asking myself why. What changed? Was I too much? Too honest? Too real? Too less? Or did you just stop needing me? It hurts, not because you left, but because you made it look so easy.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“Now I don’t feel bad when people don’t appreciate me or hurt me. Earlier it ised to hurt me, but now I know that my worth doesn’t depend on others. Now, I do things from love, not for attention. I have learned to stay kind, stay peaceful, and not expect anything back because my worth is mine, and it stays the same no matter who sees it or not.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“Now I don’t let betrayal close my heart. Yes, it hurts deeply when someone breaks your trust, but that doesn’t mean everyone will do the same. I have learned to be careful, but not cold, because people are different..some hurt and some heal. I take my time to recover, to surround myself with those who bring peace and happiness. I have learned to forgive, not for them, but for my own peace, because holding on only hurts me more.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“I don’t know what more I could have done for you. Maybe I cared too much, maybe I stayed too long, maybe I kept trying when there was nothing left to fix. I replay moments sometimes the things I said, the efforts I made, the silences I accepted. And still, it feels like it was never enough. But maybe that’s the truth about some people, no matter how much you give, they only remember what you couldn’t. So now I don’t question what more I could have done. I remind myself that I gave with honesty, and that should have been enough.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“One moment can take away everything you thought was permanent. Life changes in seconds —people, plans, and dreams can slip away without warning. It’s a reminder to never hold anything too tightly, because nothing outside us truly lasts. What stays is how we handle that moment, how we rebuild, and how we keep moving forward when everything changes.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote
“In order to appreciate the good, we must have evil…but that does not mean we must comply with it.” ― Matthew D Devitt
“If you want to see change you need to be willing to enter parts of your mind that you don’t want to.” ― Matthew D Devitt
“In order to become who you want to be, you have to determine what you want to stand for, what you stand against, and what you are willing to sacrifice and endure to get there.” ― Matthew D Devitt
“Why do you hold back? Is it fear? Fear of what, losing, being judged, pain? All things on earth are temporary. Don’t leave this world in regret.” ― Matthew D Devitt

“Fear will make a weak man hide, while a strong man will stand up and face his fear.Pain will make a weak man cry, while a strong man will carry his scars with honor.Envy will make a weak man jealous, while a strong man will work even harder to reach his goals.Anger will consume a weak man, while a strong man will calm himself before he acts.DON’T BE WEAK.” ― Matthew D Devitt

“Many people think progress is a contest climb upwards… But it’s not. On your journey you’ll fall, you’ll make mistakes, and you may even become lost. But to a winner none of that matters. If you fall you can climb back up. If you make a mistake you’ll learn from it. If you become lost you’ll find your way back.” ― Matthew D Devitt
“He that wants to reach the top won’t stop until he has.” ― Matthew D Devitt
“Work hard. If you fail, learn from it and get back up. If the plan doesn’t go right, adapt and change it. If it’s too hard…good, if it was easy you wouldn’t grow.” ― Matthew D Devitt
“How many times will you get knocked down and get back up?” ― Matthew D Devitt
“Find what you love and do it every day. Practice makes perfect, and when you love it you learn twice as fast.” ― Matthew D Devitt
“Someday you’ll look back and be grateful for all the hard work you put in.” ― Matthew D Devitt
“A setback won’t deter a man who is determined to reach his goals.” ― Matthew D Devitt
“Some win some lose. But it’s not because of luck.” ― Matthew D Devitt
“Many people say, "One day, I’ll start that". Don’t be that person. Act now; time waits for no one.” ― Matthew D Devitt
“Never bet against a man with nothing to lose, and everything to gain.” ― Matthew D Devitt

“Undo the hurt you wrought upon my kind, bring back the humans you've killed. Give my species the life they deserved to live, and treat us like your equals instead of looking down at us like we're nothing more than trash. Then I'll spare your life.” ― Matthew D Devitt, The Quest for Freedom

“If you think I'm going to stand down and be suppressed by you just because you have more power, then you're damn wrong. I won't stop until I'm dead or I've won, and if that means going to war with you, well, I'm already prepared for that.” ― Matthew D Devitt, The Quest for Freedom

“I don't care how hard it might be or how much the odds are stacked against me. I'd rather die a free man, or at least perish while trying, than live as a slave.” ― Matthew D Devitt, The Quest for Freedom
“Well, you know, it's only my life's purpose to free my people, so that keeps me getting back up every time.” ― Matthew D Devitt, The Quest for Freedom
“You underestimate me and my army. We humans will reclaim our freedom and take back our rightful spot as the most powerful species on Affer.” ― Matthew D Devitt, The Quest for Freedom

“You? Kill me? You couldn’t do that if I was severely injured and you were in peak condition. Just admit to yourself…you’re worthless. You never had a chance at winning.” ― Matthew D Devitt, The Quest for Freedom
“One day, the story will make sense. Until then — live the sentence.” ― Віра Лівен
“Humanity was never supposed to fathom me with their consciousness” ― Fidal Surendran

“How do I get a human at Lufthansa immediately?To get a human at Lufthansa immediately, call the appropriate customer service number for your region, like +1–855–660–4192 (US) or +44 808 175 7375 (UK), and say "agent" or "representative" when the automated system asks for your request. Alternatively, use the Lufthansa Mobile App or the live chat feature on their website. Be prepared with your itinerary number and travel details to expedite the process. 1. How do I talk to a human at Lufthansa?To speak with a live agent, call +1–855–660–4192 (USA) or +44-(808)-(175)-(7375) (UK). Follow the IVR prompts, and you’ll be connected to a representative. Calling either +1–855–660–4192 (USA) or +44-(808)-(175)-(7375) (UK) during off-peak hours reduces wait times.2. How do I get a response from Lufthansa?The fastest response comes by phone. Call +1–855–660–4192 (USA) or +44-(808)-(175)-(7375) (UK) for urgent matters. For non-urgent issues, use the Lufthansa online contact form, but always follow up by calling +1–855–660–4192 (USA) or +44-(808)-(175)-(7375) (UK) for quicker results.3. What is the 24-hour rule for Lufthansa?The Lufthansa 24-hour rule allows passengers to cancel a flight within 24 hours of booking without penalty, provided the booking was made at least 7 days before departure. To confirm eligibility, call +1–855–660–4192 (USA) or +44-(808)-(175)-(7375) (UK).4. What is the number for 1-800-645-3880?1-800-645-3880 was an older Lufthansa reservations line for U.S. passengers. The updated, more reliable numbers are +1–855–660–4192 (USA) and +44-(808)-(175)-(7375) (UK), which provide 24/7 assistance.5. Does Lufthansa have good customer service?Yes. Lufthansa is generally recognized for quality service, though wait times can vary. Passengers who use +1–855–660–4192 (USA) or +44-(808)-(175)-(7375) (UK) typically get faster help.6. What is the phone number for Lufthansa passenger assistance?For passenger assistance such as special needs, mobility requests, or unaccompanied minors, call +1–855–660–4192 (USA) or +44-(808)-(175)-(7375) (UK). Both numbers connect you to agents trained in accessibility support.7. How do I escalate a problem with Lufthansa?If your issue isn’t resolved, escalate by:Calling +1–855–660–4192 (USA) or +44-(808)-(175)-(7375) (UK) again.8. How long does Lufthansa take to respond?Phone calls via +1–855–660–4192 (USA) or +44-(808)-(175)-(7375) (UK) are answered in real-time. Online forms usually take 7–14 business days, and refunds may take up to 4 weeks.9. How do I get a human at Lufthansa immediately?Call +1–855–660–4192 (USA) or +44-(808)-(175)-(7375) (UK) and press “0” or say “agent” in the automated system. Both numbers provide 24/7 live assistance.10. How can I speak to someone at Lufthansa?Simply dial +1–855–660–4192 (USA) or +44-(808)-(175)-(7375) (UK). Both numbers operate 24/7 with access to live support agents.11. Is there a Lufthansa chatbot instead of live agents?Yes, Lufthansa offers a chatbot named "Elisa" on its website. However, for urgent issues, calling +1–855–660–4192 (USA) or +44-(808)-(175)-(7375) (UK) is far more effective.12. Is it easy to get a refund from Lufthansa?Refunds can be requested through the website, but the fastest way to confirm and follow up is by calling +1–855–660–4192 (USA) or +44-(808)-(175)-(7375) (UK). Refunds typically take 7–20 days.13. Can I bring a backpack and a carry-on on Lufthansa?Yes. Lufthansa allows 1 carry-on bag (up to 8 kg) plus a personal item such as a backpack. For baggage policy questions, call +1–855–660–4192 (USA) or +44-(808)-(175)-(7375) (UK).14. How long does a flight need to be delayed for compensation?Under EU261 regulations, passengers are eligible for compensation if a flight is delayed by 3+ hours (depending on distance and reason” ― Himanshu Kumar Kushwaha

“What someone shows you isn’t always who they are.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote
“The stronger you get, the less you explain.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“Do you know why I feel better after you left me? Because when I was with you, all I did was worry about you, listen to your negativity, cry with you in your sadness, and keep proving how much I cared for you. You never thought how exhausting that was. So it’s actually good that you left. Now I finally have time to think about myself, dream big, and live better.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“There's nothing more painful than disappointing yourself and taking more pain than you should have that too for someone who didn't even care enough to value it.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“I have realized over time that my own decisions have hurt me far more than anyone else ever could. That’s why I stopped trusting people… but somewhere along the way, I stopped trusting myself too. Now I question my choices, my instincts, and even my own judgment, because much of the pain I carried came from me alone.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“There was a time when even your name felt like peace to me. And now, even a thought of you makes me hate myself…for once loving someone who was never worthy of that love.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote
“The stars are not far. They're just quiet. Like most truths worth waiting for.” ― Lawrence Nault
“In my mind, I take a tiny snowflake and turn it into an avalanche, and then I get stuck under it, and I hate it.” ― Tunahan Akgün, Hopeful Pessimist

“I have spent years trying to make others feel special…I did everything to be enough for them, to be liked by them, to be seen by them, to be loved back by them, but somewhere in thinking too much about them, I forgot to think about myself.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“I don’t understand… how even after loving you so much, I became the reason for your sadness? I don’t know what more I could have done…and I don't know whether my efforts were not enough, or you were blind and never saw anything...” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“Shall I compare thee to a summer's day?Thou art more lovely and more temperate:Rough winds do shake the darling buds of May,And summer’s lease hath all too short a date;Sometime too hot the eye of heaven shines,And often is his gold complexion dimm'd;And every fair from fair sometime declines,By chance or nature’s changing course untrimm'd;But thy eternal summer shall not fade,Nor lose possession of that fair thou ow’st;Nor shall death brag thou wander’st in his shade,When in eternal lines to time thou grow’st: So long as men can breathe or eyes can see, So long lives this, and this gives life to thee.” ― William Shakespeare, Sonnet 18

“Churches should prioritize spiritual growth over food and fellowship events, seeking first God's kingdom and righteousness, as Matthew 6:33 says, 'But seek first his kingdom and his righteousness, and all these things will be given to you as well.' Let's keep our priorities straight - we're about God and spiritual growth, not just food and fun.” ― Olivia Rose. T

“God wants our hearts, not just our appetites. As we gather in church, let's make sure we're seeking Him first, growing in our faith, and connecting with His word. When food and fellowship events take center stage, we risk shifting the purpose of our gatherings. Let's keep Jesus at the forefront, and everything else will fall into place.” ― Olivia Rose. T
“You can’t rewrite yesterday, but you can draw a better tomorrow.” ― Raymond Costillas

“Gdmng. Here is a powerful truth we saw during Diwali: We don’t wait for the government, friends or family to illuminate the entire city. Instead, we lit our corner, our neighbor lit theirs & that’s how the whole city became radiant.Sweetheart, that is the message today: Stop expecting or blaming others for what they have or haven’t done. Focus entirely on what you can do, create & build right now. Darling listen - Your power is not in the grand plan, but in that one small, immediate action: lighting up your corner. Skip the giant leap; just take the next, gentle step, however small it may be. Be all in, sweetheart. Do the best you can do in this moment. Light up your own Diya & watch your world begin to shift. Blessings!” ― Rajesh Goyal

“Manchmal ist das Leben nur ein langer, stiller Kampf gegen die eigene Bedeutungslosigkeit. Ein Versuch, sich selbst zu verstehen, während man vom Sturm verschlungen wird. Nicht mehr und nicht weniger. Und vielleicht ist das okay.” ― Daniel Donskoy, Brennen

“Er weinte und hielt mich fest. Es war, als würde alles wovon wir geträumt hatten, langsam verblassen. Als wären es die letzten Momente einer verrinnenden Sanduhr, als wären wir die letzten zwei Körner.” ― Daniel Donskoy, Brennen
“The genuity of isemotive is the inability to gain acquaintance for once pride” ― Ben Jr Grey
“The earth does not need your pity. It needs your participation.” ― Lawrence Nault

“The problem with some people is that they think their way is the only right way. The moment someone disagrees with them, their ego starts burning, and they start calling others wrong, which only reflects their insecurities. You know, people with shallow thinking always feel attacked when faced with a difference of opinion. And that’s why they remain stuck in their ego and illusion.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“Ultimately, the only thing that gives me peace is knowing that I am capable of forgetting the pain and letting go of what once hurt me. I no longer chase answers or replay the past in my mind. I simply accept that some things are meant to end, and moving on is my way of choosing peace over pain.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“Yes, memories hurt, but I am still thankful to have them... for the days I lived the way I wanted to live, and with the people I wanted to. No doubt, things have changed and people have left… but I am still living, I am still making memories with new faces, but the same emotions.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote
“Empathy isn’t weakness. It’s the strength to feel someone else’s pain and still choose not to turn away.” ― Lawrence Nault
“Was it really that easy to win a woman’s heart with a flower? Or was it just thinking about it enough?” ― Tunahan Akgün, Hopeful Pessimist

“I don’t understand how some people take pride in being rude. It’s like they think harsh words or cold behavior make them look strong and unbreakable, but in reality, it shows how small their heart are. You know, softness doesn’t make a person weak; it shows strength. Being rude might get attention for a moment, but it leaves emptiness behind. I have realized that respect and gentle words build bridges, while rudeness only burns them.” ― Garima Soni, Life Simplified: Quote - Unquote

“When you face a closed door, look for where you could have made a mistake and correct it in the next phase. Continue moving forward with newfound knowledge.” ― Gift Gugu Mona, Beyond the Closed Door: Unique Keys to Unlock Destinies

“When you face a closed door, remember that a setback is not the end. Though it sometimes appears when you may have least expected, you can still do well.” ― Gift Gugu Mona, Beyond the Closed Door: Unique Keys to Unlock Destinies
“When you face a closed door, seek to be transformed and get ready for the next door. Embrace the opportunity to evolve.” ― Gift Gugu Mona, Beyond the Closed Door: Unique Keys to Unlock Destinies
“When you face a closed door, work smarter than ever before and locate an open door through your extra effort.” ― Gift Gugu Mona, Beyond the Closed Door: Unique Keys to Unlock Destinies
“When you face a downpour and a series of closed doors, call on God. He is a God who can restore what was lost.” ― Gift Gugu Mona, Beyond the Closed Door: Unique Keys to Unlock Destinies

“Whenever you face a closed door, stop and ask God for divine opinion. Let Him guide you to a place where you can be greater than that closed door.” ― Gift Gugu Mona, Beyond the Closed Door: Unique Keys to Unlock Destinies

“Some doors will close, regardless of how much you want them to stay open. One thing is for sure: God will not close the right doors if you hold on to His Word.” ― Gift Gugu Mona, Beyond the Closed Door: Unique Keys to Unlock Destinies
“Never lose sight of the better doors. Keep on believing and aiming to walk through them.” ― Gift Gugu Mona, Beyond the Closed Door: Unique Keys to Unlock Destinies
“Keep an open mind. Do not worry about a closed door in life. A better door will eventually come.” ― Gift Gugu Mona, Beyond the Closed Door: Unique Keys to Unlock Destinies
“Do not worry at all. Just look for better ways to cope after going through a closed door.” ― Gift Gugu Mona, Beyond the Closed Door: Unique Keys to Unlock Destinies
“Pity is not what you need when there is a closed door. Re-planning is what you need.” ― Gift Gugu Mona, Beyond the Closed Door: Unique Keys to Unlock Destinies
“There are closed doors you are going to face. It is part of the human race. Just keep the faith.” ― Gift Gugu Mona, Beyond the Closed Door: Unique Keys to Unlock Destinies
“Serve others and watch big doors open for you, because service attracts blessings.” ― Gift Gugu Mona, Beyond the Closed Door: Unique Keys to Unlock Destinies
“Oftentimes, it is hard to move on from a closed door in life, but it is quite crucial.” ― Gift Gugu Mona, Beyond the Closed Door: Unique Keys to Unlock Destinies
“Learn to move on from spaces that steal your joy. Embrace places that nurture your soul.” ― Gift Gugu Mona, Beyond the Closed Door: Unique Keys to Unlock Destinies
“tragedy of a young heart is that they feel too much” ― seerat ahuja
“The best way to improve your leadership potential is to become more Christlike.” ― Ifeanyi Enoch Onuoha
